steps.title: Terms & Conditions

sections.title: Note to Applicants

questions.label: I have read and understood terms and conditions

sections.description:
• Please complete all sections.
• Applications for threatened flora authorisations must be submitted at least 6-8 weeks prior to the proposed  take or disturbance of the species.
• If the application is incomplete or does not have sufficient detail to assess the level of risk to the threatened  flora, an assessor may contact the applicant via phone or email to request further detail or decline the  application due to insufficient information, and request resubmission.
• The risk to the conservation of biodiversity is considered in accordance with “Guideline for assessing risks  to the conservation of biodiversity associated with threatened species and threatened ecological  communities”.
• To reduce the level of risk to species, conditions may be applied to authorisations to adequately mitigate or  offset the impact
• Activities that directly or indirectly cause the take or disturbance of listed threatened flora require a Ministerial  authorisation under s 40 of the Biodiversity Conservation Act 2016 (BC Act).
• To take includes to gather, pluck, cut, pull up, destroy, dig up, remove, harvest or damage flora by any means. 
• To disturb is to engage in an activity that has the effect, whether directly or indirectly, of altering the longterm persistence of the flora in its habitat.
• An application for a threatened flora authorisation should be completed for any activity that has the  potential, whether directly or indirectly, of taking or disturbing threatened flora. Please contact  speciesandcommunities@dbca.wa.gov.au for advice if you are unsure your activity will meet the definition  of take of disturb.
• Information on the location of threatened flora populations can be requested through Species and  Communities Program by emailing flora.data@dbca.wa.gov.au.
• Completed application form to be emailed to: speciesandcommunities@dbca.wa.gov.au with all relevant  attachments, or forwarded to: Species and Communities Program, Department of Biodiversity, Conservation  and Attractions, Locked Bag 104 Bentley Delivery Centre WA 6983.
• Further information may be obtained from the DBCA website Authorisation to take and disturb threatened  flora or by emailing speciesandcommunities@dbca.wa.gov.au..

sections.title: Disclosure and declaration

questions.label: All details provided by me to the Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions (DBCA) in relation to  this application are true and correct, and I consent to the use and disclosure of information for the purposes  described above

sections.description: Information that you provide will be used and disclosed in accordance with sections 274 and 275 of the BC Act.  This may include use for license or authorisation monitoring and compliance, to inform you of any license or  authorisation legislative requirements or changes, and disclosure to other State and Commonwealth agencies for  administration or enforcement purposes. You also consent to the release of information in relation to the granting  of the authorisation, and any conditions of the authorisation, in response to inquiries made to the Department. Applicant declaration: All details provided by me to the Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions (DBCA) in relation to  this application are true and correct, and I consent to the use and disclosure of information for the purposes described above.

steps.description: Read and accept our terms of service.

questions.label: Physical address
questions.description: Residential or associated institution / company / group address.

questions.label: Postal address same as physical address
Have you been convicted of an offence under the BC Act in the past five years?
If yes, please provide details and offence date
Is your proposal subject to other approvals?
questions.description: e.g. licenses or other authorisations under the BC Act, and/or  approvals under the (Part IV and V Environmental Protection Act 1986), the Planning and Development Act 2005,  Mining Act 1978, and Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999. Note: Assessments may  be undertaken concurrently by the appropriate organisations under each applicable legislation.

questions.label: List of other approvals required
questions.description: Please indicate if the approval is pending or if  it has been issued. If approvals have been issued, where available, please attach a copy or provide a link to  the approval/relevant information (e.g. Ministerial Statement). Please insert additional rows if multiple approvals  are required:

grid_columns.label: Issued
grid_columns.description: The approval has been already issued or still pending

grid_columns.label: Approval type
grid_columns.description: Can this be list of options?

grid_columns.label: Additional
grid_columns.description: Further information and/or details of relevant conditions on the approval (can refer to above attachment if appropriate):

questions.label: Parallel processing
questions.description: If your proposal is currently being assessed under Part IV of the Environmental Protection Act 1986, please indicate below if you would like this application to be considered for parallel processing.
select_options: Yes, please consider this application for parallel processing.
No, I do not wish to be considered for parallel processing.

questions.label: Proposal name and Environment Online reference number

sections.title: Details of the threatened flora

questions.label: Scientific name(s) of threatened flora to be taken or disturbed
questions.description: (if more than one taxon please list all)

questions.label: Registered DBCA database population number/s of the threatened flora (if known)
Total number(s) and condition of plants in threatened flora population(s) subject to the proposed  activity (include reproductive maturity): (e.g. mature / juvenile / seedlings)
Number(s) of plants and parts of plants likely to be taken or disturbed (e.g. leaves, flowers, fruits, seeds  on ground, stem, roots, above ground plants, whole plants) at the time proposed
Total number of populations
questions.description: Total number of populations, number of plants and condition of the species

questions.label: Detail regenerative characteristics of the threatened flora as applicable to activity, where known: e.g.  known to regenerate from soil stored seed after disturbance

sections.description: Scientific name(s) of threatened flora to be taken or disturbed
